alertDefProperties.name: RUM - High Page Load Time
alertDefProperties.description:
This alert monitors elevated page load times experienced by users, as reported through Real User Monitoring (RUM) data. High page load times can lead to poor user experience, increased bounce rates, and lower engagement.

The alert is triggered when the average page load time exceeds a specified threshold (e.g., 1 seconds) over a defined monitoring period (e.g., 10 minutes).

Monitoring this metric helps ensure optimal website performance and responsiveness, which is critical for user satisfaction and retention.

Customization Guidance:
  - Threshold: Define the threshold based on acceptable user experience standards and typical load times for your application.
  - Monitoring Period: Use shorter windows for real-time responsiveness or longer ones to detect sustained performance degradation.
  - Notification Frequency: Limit notifications to repeated or prolonged occurrences to avoid alert fatigue while maintaining awareness.

Action: If this alert is triggered, analyze RUM data to identify affected pages or user regions, review recent frontend or backend changes, and check for third-party service delays or network issues.
